We love designing patterns to support our line of beautiful yarns. You'll find a substantial amount of free and paid patterns and ebooks in our pattern collections. We offer everything from garments and accessories to homewares and adorable toys.

pattern_sources.author: Renee Strouts
pattern_sources.name: Main & Mini Sock Series
pattern_sources.notes:
A sock series that uses a full skein and mini skein "Sock Set" in ways that are more creative than just contrasting heels & toes. 

The ebook builds in a constant running early/earlier/earliest bird special:

* The current price of the ebook will always cost less than buying each pattern individually (built-in discount)

* Every time a new pattern is added, the price of the ebook will be raised, since it has more content

* If you buy the ebook now, you get any future sock patterns free, since they will be added to the existing ebook (early bird!)

* The designer makes **no promises** as to if, when, or how many additional socks will be added to the series, but the original plans included approximately 10 sock patterns

pattern_sources.author: Helen Stewart
pattern_sources.name: The Handmade Sock Society 6
pattern_sources.notes:
> The Handmade Sock Society is a mystery
> pattern collection for knitters who
> cherish handmade socks and delightful
> surprises. Over six months, I release
> six secret sock patterns, and members
> participate in a lively knitalong.
> It's always a wonderful experience of
> discovery and connection.
>
> This season of the Handmade Sock Society is inspired by the dreamy aesthetics of light academia: a cosy atmosphere of 
> sunlit libraries, antique writing desks, and snug reading nooks. Its dedicated to the secret worlds inside our journals,  our favourite stories, our sketchbooks, and our daydreams.

We find ourselves drawn to the quiet corners where ideas flourish: a hushed library, an antique roll-top desk, or just a favourite cosy chair. Any precious room of our own, no matter how small, where we can give ourselves over to the joy of our own thoughts and express our own creativity.

With six captivating new sock knitting patterns to discover, the sixth season of the Handmade Sock Society is a nod to scholarly pursuits and the romance of the writers life. 

The Handmade Sock Society 6 release dates:

Secret Pattern 1 - Thursday, May 1st, 2025
Secret Pattern 2 - Thursday, June 5th, 2025
Secret Pattern 3 - Thursday, July 3rd, 2025
Secret Pattern 4 - Thursday, August 7th, 2025
Secret Pattern 5 - Thursday, September 4th, 2025
Secret Pattern 6 - Thursday, October 2nd, 2025

Writing (and knitting!) by hand is a way to escape from the grind of the digital world, into moments of pure tactile creation. The satisfying weight of a fountain pen gliding over creamy parchment, or the gentle rhythm of needles sliding through wool. The subtle aromas of leather-bound journals and polished wood, or the comforting scent of a freshly wound skein. From the graceful script of a practiced hand to the even stitches of a careful knitter, from the precise impressions of a manual letterpress to the slow shaping of a sock heel, these parallel crafts speak of tradition, care, and the enduring human hope that we can leave our own lovely mark on this world.

Join us and embark on a season of secret sock patterns and the warm camaraderie of like-minded knitters. No matter your skill level, theres a place for you in the Handmade Sock Society. Whether youre a curious beginner setting out on your first sock-knitting adventure or an experienced sock enthusiast seeking fresh inspiration, this collection of mystery patterns and our welcoming community of thoughtful makers will nurture your creative spirit.

Each pattern has been thoughtfully designed to balance meditative knitting and interesting details, with detailed instructions and delightful stitch patterns that capture the essence of the writers craft. As always, the collection offers a satisfying variety of design elements to explore: touches of elegant lace, engaging textures, and techniques that celebrate our shared heritage of handcraft.

pattern_sources.author: Alexa Ludeman and Emily Wessel
pattern_sources.name: The Simple Collection
pattern_sources.notes:
**The Simple Collection ::: learn to knit with Alexa and Emily**

This year at Tin Can Knits we explore the basic ingredients of knitting.  The Simple Collection has quick accessories and simple sweaters, sized from baby to big and best of all ** the patterns are all free for you to use and share with your friends!** 

With free patterns (including sweaters!) and clear tutorials, the collection is perfect for newer knitters building skills and confidence; and also a treat for knitters who enjoy modern lines and simple details. Whether you are knitting your first scarf, socks, or sweater, the Simple Collection will teach you all you need to know to make modern seamless knits for the whole family!

pattern_sources.name: Laine Magazine, Issue 11
pattern_sources.notes:
*Laine* is a high-quality knit & lifestyle magazine for knit folks. We cherish natural fibres, slow living, local craftsmanship, and beautiful, simple things in life. Our intention is to inspire you to gather and share, to be part of a community of like-minded knitters, makers and thinkers from near and far. Knitting is more than just knit, knit, purl. It is a feeling.

Laine Summer 2021, *Marjoram*, includes:

* 148 pages
* 11 knitting patterns, beautifully photographed and illustrated
* an interview with Diane Ivey of Lady Dye Yarns written by Jeanette Sloan
* an article about the knitting app Knitrino
* an article about Yarningham written by Jeanette Sloan
* an article about knitting and cognitive resilience by our regular writer Pivi Kankaro
* a column by our regular columnist Jeanette Sloan
* seasonal recipes
* book reviews
* Laine Favourites section.

Designers featured in this issue: Stella Ackroyd, Christelle Bagea, George Cullen, Jonna Hietala, Gudrun Johnston, Marianne Munier, Paula Pereira, Eri Shimizu, Nataliya Sinelshchikova and Stephen West.


Publication day: 7 May, 2021.

Print only. No digital download code available.

Available in two language versions: in English and Finnish.

pattern_sources.notes:
From lace, to knitted jewelry with beads, to sweaters, socks and children's garments... Laura's patterns will teach you new techniques with well written, concise directions.  All patterns are tech edited and test knitted.  Many of them include video tutorials for the tricksy bits!

Like Lauras designs and interested in her clubs? [**Sign up to receive email updates**][1] so you dont miss out on tutorials, new patterns and kits, and subscriber-only special offers! PLUS new subscribers get a coupon code for 15% off all of my independently published patterns when you sign up!

I have two SUPER FUN clubs! One, [**Lolas Choice**][2] is all about smaller projects (and has on-going sign-ups) and the other [**The N Club**][3] has larger projects and only has sign ups open once a year.

Any questions about my designs? Please **[check out my Ravelry group][4]** it is awesome, and helpful, and fun! If you want to keep up with what I am doing you can follow my blog AND sign up for my mailing list!

And finally.... **[need a kit?][5]**

pattern_sources.author: Maja Klvdal
pattern_sources.name: Other Loops_
pattern_sources.notes:
Other Loops / otherloops.com

> If you have questions, comments or
> need knitting support, you are welcome
> to write to us on
> support@otherloops.com

 

Behind Other Loops you will meet up with Maja Klvdal, who has a degree as fashion designer from the Design School Kolding in Denmark DK:DK Since her education, Maja has made a career in the fashion industry, where she has worked and accelerated the growth for several well-known Danish fashion brands.

Other Loops are born from Majas dream of making more slow fashion and returning to her own roots, which is to create and develop on the actual craft.
Maja focus on aesthetics, quality and details that go side by side with the traditions of Scandinavian design.

Maja create classic and modern knitwear patterns that suite your needs of long-lasting design. Other Loops put heart into developing precise patterns that are straight forward for you to understand, so your personal knitting skills elevate up to next level.

Otherloops.com develop aesthetic quality design for you and the future to come.

For more inspiration you can also follow the brand on Instagram @otherloops
If you have questions, comments or need knitting support, you are welcome to write to us on support@otherloops.com 
Pattern is solely for private use and must not be copied, resold, or shared. Products made from the patterns may not be sold.

> If you have questions, comments or
> need knitting support, you are welcome
> to write to us on
> support@otherloops.com

Happy loops!

pattern_sources.author: Kieran Foley
pattern_sources.name: knit/lab
pattern_sources.notes:
My username is [**knitlab**][1] and my website is [**kieranfoley.com**][2]

**Inventive knitting patterns.**
More info on techniques [here][3] on my website, including some [phototutorials][5].
If you have questions about my patterns, try the [**knit/lab group**][6].
Visit the [**knit/lab blog**][7], my [**Pinterest boards**][8] and  [**Instagram**][9] for photos and inspirations.

**Special Offers!**
**15% off 2 patterns!**
**20% off 3 or 4 patterns!**
**25% off 5 or more patterns!**
Add to cart 2 or more patterns from my [**Ravelry Store**][12] and the discount is applied automatically.\*

pattern_sources.author: Summer Lee
pattern_sources.name: The Sock Project: Colorful, Cool Socks to Knit and Show Off
pattern_sources.notes:
Oklahoma native and proud member of the Muscogee-Creek Nation, Summer Lee shares her knitting secrets for creating all shapes and sizes of socks with dots, zigzags, stripes, and a near-neon palette of happy colors.

Sock projects are universally loved by knitters, but popular knitting creator Summer Lee has turned this favorite pastime topsy turvy with designs that feature the most electric colors and wow-patterns ever dreamt up. The Sock Project is a book for every crafter: beginners who want to learn, knitters who want to improve their sock skills, and anyone who wants to fill their knitting needlesand sock drawerswith jazzy colors and new designs.

Build your skills month-by-month with 12 levels of sock knitting. First, start with the humble-but-mighty Basic Sock, then try more complicated patterns for lace socks, cabled socks, socks with Estonian Inlay, and socks done in stranded knitting. Youll be able to sample 18 fresh and zippy patterns, plus new variations on favorite designs! The Sock Project is a joyful Starburst-color explosion for adventurous knitters everywhere.

pattern_sources.name: Shetland Wool Week Annual 2024, Volume 10
pattern_sources.notes:
Release date: 29th September 2024

PRINTED EDITION. A Digital PDF Edition and a combined Printed & Digital PDF Edition are also available.

The Shetland Wool Week Annual, Volume 10 includes ten stunning patterns that highlight the versatility and beauty of Shetland wool, Fair Isle, and lace knitting. It features inspiring photos from the Westside of Shetland, where unfazed sheep roam the landscape and breathtaking views abound. Whether youre drawn to natural hues or bold colours, intricate lace, or the careful positioning of Fair Isle motifs, we hope these pages inspire you to pick up your needles, raid your wool stashes, and immerse yourself in the timeless art of knitting.

Patterns:
Laebrak Hap by Elizabeth Johnston
Matts Hat by Donna Smith 
Islesburgh Toorie by Anne Doull
Volda Lace Top by Linda Shearer
Given tae da Lent Gravit by Alison Rendall and Nina Moncrieff
Skalva Socks by Freya Hutcheson
Vegr Vest by Ella Gordon
Flying Flock by Helen Robertson 
Winyadepla Scarf by Betsy Williamson
Vatster Mittens by Janette Budge

Features:
Stitches in Time  Preserving Shetlands Knitting Legacy  10 Years of the SWW Annual
Discovering Shetlands Lace Knitting Traditions
Unsung Ganseys  Rediscovering Shetlands Ganseys
From London Beats to Lerwick Streets  Capturing the Spirit of Pre-Oil Shetland through Fair Isle Knitwear Photography by Chris Morphet 
True Colours  in Search of Lost Hues: A Journey Through Shetlands Wool Heritage

Pages: 144
ISBN: 978-1-0687289-0-7

pattern_sources.keywords: Jennifer Shiels Toland's Ravelry Store, JST Designs
pattern_sources.name: JSTDesigns
pattern_sources.notes:
> **[Brioche Del Mar][1]**

Brioche Del Mar is an ode to the many shorelines Ive strolled over the years and the wonderful Caf del Mar chill-out albums I listened to endlessly in the late 90s.

Brioche Del Mar is the perfect combination of knitting to keep you engaged at the start, watch T.V. knitting the body, and then re-engage you for a two colour Brioche finish (the hem)! 

This oversized top, lots of positive airy ease, is worked seamlessly from the top down. It starts out with a separate back worked in the flat, and then the front to the arm holes. The fronts and backs are joined to work down in the round to the Brioche hem after the armholes are complete. Two colour brioche ends the sweater with a scalloped shell edge.

The sleeves have two cuff options  either a mesh eyelet or a simple twisted rib  you decide!



  [1]: https://www.ravelry.com/patterns/library/brioche-del-mar

pattern_sources.author: Helen Stewart
pattern_sources.name: The Handmade Sock Society 6
pattern_sources.notes:
> The Handmade Sock Society is a mystery
> pattern collection for knitters who
> cherish handmade socks and delightful
> surprises. Over six months, I release
> six secret sock patterns, and members
> participate in a lively knitalong.
> It's always a wonderful experience of
> discovery and connection.
>
> This season of the Handmade Sock Society is inspired by the dreamy aesthetics of light academia: a cosy atmosphere of 
> sunlit libraries, antique writing desks, and snug reading nooks. Its dedicated to the secret worlds inside our journals,  our favourite stories, our sketchbooks, and our daydreams.

We find ourselves drawn to the quiet corners where ideas flourish: a hushed library, an antique roll-top desk, or just a favourite cosy chair. Any precious room of our own, no matter how small, where we can give ourselves over to the joy of our own thoughts and express our own creativity.

With six captivating new sock knitting patterns to discover, the sixth season of the Handmade Sock Society is a nod to scholarly pursuits and the romance of the writers life. 

The Handmade Sock Society 6 release dates:

Secret Pattern 1 - Thursday, May 1st, 2025
Secret Pattern 2 - Thursday, June 5th, 2025
Secret Pattern 3 - Thursday, July 3rd, 2025
Secret Pattern 4 - Thursday, August 7th, 2025
Secret Pattern 5 - Thursday, September 4th, 2025
Secret Pattern 6 - Thursday, October 2nd, 2025

Writing (and knitting!) by hand is a way to escape from the grind of the digital world, into moments of pure tactile creation. The satisfying weight of a fountain pen gliding over creamy parchment, or the gentle rhythm of needles sliding through wool. The subtle aromas of leather-bound journals and polished wood, or the comforting scent of a freshly wound skein. From the graceful script of a practiced hand to the even stitches of a careful knitter, from the precise impressions of a manual letterpress to the slow shaping of a sock heel, these parallel crafts speak of tradition, care, and the enduring human hope that we can leave our own lovely mark on this world.

Join us and embark on a season of secret sock patterns and the warm camaraderie of like-minded knitters. No matter your skill level, theres a place for you in the Handmade Sock Society. Whether youre a curious beginner setting out on your first sock-knitting adventure or an experienced sock enthusiast seeking fresh inspiration, this collection of mystery patterns and our welcoming community of thoughtful makers will nurture your creative spirit.

Each pattern has been thoughtfully designed to balance meditative knitting and interesting details, with detailed instructions and delightful stitch patterns that capture the essence of the writers craft. As always, the collection offers a satisfying variety of design elements to explore: touches of elegant lace, engaging textures, and techniques that celebrate our shared heritage of handcraft.

pattern_sources.author: Maria Kostamovaara, Jaana Etula, Emma Kylml, Minttu Wikberg
pattern_sources.name: Knits from our Gardens
pattern_sources.notes:
This knitting book is rooted in soil, the miracle of growth and the joy of harvest - with the garden at its heart. Its four creators are not only seasoned knitwear designers but also passionate gardeners. Inspired by their love of tending green spaces, they've brought together a shared collection of 20 beautiful knitwear and crochet patterns that celebrate the colours of the natural world. Inside, you'll find garments and accessories for every season, including two designs for children.

Step into the blooming gardens of the four designers, brought to life through stories and photography. Who nurtures an urban plot in London? Who wakes to birdsong in a village once known for its ironworks? What's life like in an allotment garden- and how to channel cosy cottage garden charm with a modern twist?

Knits from our Garden is a tribute to the sense of meaning we find in making things by hand. Welcome to a world where creativity flourishes - in both knitwear and gardens!

pattern_sources.author: Minttu Wikberg, Emma Kylml, Jaana Etula, Maria Kostamovaara
pattern_sources.name: Silmuja ja silmukoita
pattern_sources.notes:
Tmn neulekirjan juuret ovat syvll mullassa, lumoavassa kasvun ihmeess, sadonkorjuun palkitsevuudessa - puutarhaelmss. Kirjan nelj suunnittelijaa ovat paitsi kokeneita neulemaailman ammattilaisia mys intohimoisia viherpeukaloita. Puutarhaharrastuksensa innoittamina he loivat omat mallistonsa: syntyi yhteens 20 luonnon vriloistoa juhlivaa neule- ja virkkausohjetta. Mukana on vaatteita ja asusteita jokaiseen vuodenaikaan sek kaksi mallia lapsille.

Astu vierailulle tekijnelikon puutarhoihin versovien tarinoiden ja kuvien kautta. Kenell on urbaani pikkupiha Lontoossa, kuka kuuntelee linnunlaulua ruukkikylss? Millaista elm eletn siirtolapuutarhassa, kuinka vaalitaan mummolafiilist modernilla otteella?

Lola's Choice is a super fun bi-monthly kit club... 'cause who doesn't love getting crafty mail?

[Sign up here!!!!][1]

Lola is my spicy alter egoand she knits too!  She is high energy and demanded a knitted kit club all to her own.  And we all know the sayingwhatever Lola wants, Lola gets. 
Lolas Choice is all about smaller fun knits.  These projects are designed to bring you joy, teach you a bit, and give you a sense of accomplishment. Best of all, theyll be fun to make AND wear!

Lola LOVES yarn, and chooses bases from her favorite dyers and finds new yarns on her travels. She consistently comes up with some pretty awesome combinations (if I do say so myself).  I know youll really enjoy these unique projects. 

When you sign up for Lolas Choice, youll be shipped your kit on schedule. Lola is timely! You have plenty of choices with Lolas Choice a 1 Kit auto-renew, 3 Kit, or 6 Kit options!

pattern_sources.name: Nelkin Designs
pattern_sources.notes:
From lace, to knitted jewelry with beads, to sweaters, socks and children's garments... Laura's patterns will teach you new techniques with well written, concise directions.  All patterns are tech edited and test knitted.  Many of them include video tutorials for the tricksy bits!

Like Lauras designs and interested in her clubs? [**Sign up to receive email updates**][1] so you dont miss out on tutorials, new patterns and kits, and subscriber-only special offers! PLUS new subscribers get a coupon code for 15% off all of my independently published patterns when you sign up!

I have two SUPER FUN clubs! One, [**Lolas Choice**][2] is all about smaller projects (and has on-going sign-ups) and the other [**The N Club**][3] has larger projects and only has sign ups open once a year.

Any questions about my designs? Please **[check out my Ravelry group][4]** it is awesome, and helpful, and fun! If you want to keep up with what I am doing you can follow my blog AND sign up for my mailing list!

And finally.... **[need a kit?][5]**

pattern_sources.author: Maria Kostamovaara, Jaana Etula, Emma Kylml, Minttu Wikberg
pattern_sources.name: Knits from our Gardens
pattern_sources.notes:
This knitting book is rooted in soil, the miracle of growth and the joy of harvest - with the garden at its heart. Its four creators are not only seasoned knitwear designers but also passionate gardeners. Inspired by their love of tending green spaces, they've brought together a shared collection of 20 beautiful knitwear and crochet patterns that celebrate the colours of the natural world. Inside, you'll find garments and accessories for every season, including two designs for children.

Step into the blooming gardens of the four designers, brought to life through stories and photography. Who nurtures an urban plot in London? Who wakes to birdsong in a village once known for its ironworks? What's life like in an allotment garden- and how to channel cosy cottage garden charm with a modern twist?

Knits from our Garden is a tribute to the sense of meaning we find in making things by hand. Welcome to a world where creativity flourishes - in both knitwear and gardens!

pattern_sources.name: Shetland Wool Week Annual 2023, Volume 9
pattern_sources.notes:
The Shetland Wool Week Annual 2023, Volume Nine has a grounded feel, taking its inspiration from the hues, textures and detail of Shetlands rugged coastline and natural landscape.

This issue includes 12 very different Fair Isle, lace and weaving patterns by Shetland knitwear designers who all bring very personal touches and a depth of detail to their work. As always, Shetland wool takes centre stage, with its endless colour options, warmth and durability.

Included is a Heritage pattern by Ella Gordon, taking inspiration from a 1950s jumper in the Shetland Museum's textile collection. One of our young knitters, Jenny Jamieson, has created a beautiful old shale lace cowl in sea shades redolent of the markings on a mackerel. Another highlight is from Hazel Tindall who has written an ingenious pattern that takes just six balls of yarn and can be knit into four different pairs of mitts; a brilliant and clever use of yarn, design and maths!

This year's features provide a deeper insight into some of the people who are involved in the wonderful world of Shetland oo  all playing a role to ensure that its heritage lives on.


Patterns:

Ella Gordon | Hattie Yoke
Elizabeth Williamson | Skelberry Shawl
Elizabeth Johnston | Starlight Blanket
Jenny Jamieson | Foogry Cowl
Emma Geddes | Krokbragd Table Runner
Donna Smith | Muckle Leaf Beret
Terri Leask | Da Waarie Jumper
Linda Shearer | Vista Vest
Nicole Coutts | Paet-Bank Gloves & Toorie
Hazel Tindall | Tak Six Kloos Mitts
Alison Rendall | Buggiflooer Beanie 

Features:

Hats off to Harriet - Laurie Goodlad meets the woman whose determination and smile captured the hearts of the world at the unveiling of a new portrait at Shetland Museum & Archives.
Making Knitwear Sing  Felicity Ford on the perils and pleasures of the annual Colourbox Challenge.
Creative Living on the Croft - The Tait family are the sixth generation to work the croft at West Lynne. Alastair Hamilton went to meet them and find out about their inspiring careers beyond tending the land.
An Object of Hope - Helen Robertsons artistic vision honours the precariousness & industry of her ancestors lives.
 

ISBN: 978-1-9164689-7-9

Binding: Paperback

Size: 256 x 204mm

Printed on FSC stock.

The sock designs in Westknits Year of Socks 2025 are available with the e-book. You will receive a new sock pattern each month in 2025. The sock patterns will be available to purchase individually in 2026.

pattern_sources.name: Knitvent 2022
pattern_sources.notes:
> **Knitvent 2022 Presales now open at special Early Bird price (no coupon needed)** Early Bird Price is 10.75 (before tax) 40% OFF the regular price of 18.00 until 27 October

Knitvent 2022 is a collection of six secret accessory patterns for you to discover and knit, one by one. Its all about gifts, surprises and holiday knitting to delight you and the lucky folks on your knitworthy list! 

Its the 10th anniversary of the Curious Handmade Knitvent tradition, and this collection captures the eclectic joy of bits and pieces, treasured odds and ends, special scraps and the little things we love to stash away. 

For Knitvent number 10, I wanted to do something a little different. Every year since 2017, the scrappy pattern has been the star of each Knitvent. Its always the biggest project in the collection, designed to be made out of 24 mini skeins, whether pulled from your stash or a curated festive set from an indie dyer. This year, I had so much fun designing that project that all I wanted to do was make more projects out of minis.

And I decided on the spot that the whole collection would be in mini skeins. 

So whether youre a stash diver who loves to forage for beautiful scraps

Or if youve got a precious set of minis but arent in the mood to commit to a giant project.

Or if you just want to knit a series of gorgeous gifts with any yarn that steals your heart

Youre going to have a lot of fun this Knitvent.

Knitvent is a cross between a holiday countdown and a mystery knit along. The experience of getting a secret knitting pattern in your inbox each week brings back the childhood joy of surprises. Its all about anticipation, surprise, and homemade gifts you can make for yourself and your loved ones...even if youve left it until almost the last minute. 

Over the course of five festive weeks, you will receive a series of secret mystery knitting patterns, each designed to be a quick and satisfying knit. Theres a strong community aspect with a busy knitalong and lovely prizes, bustling chat threads on Ravelry and tons of inspiration on Instagram with the hashtag #knitvent2022

So join us for a lighthearted exploration of holiday movies and handknit presents! Wed love to have you along. 

Purchase the the Knitvent 2022 ebook for all the fun to follow:

Knitvent Window 1 opens on Thursday, October 27th 
The collection includes six delightful knitting patterns: one pattern each week for five weeks, except for one week when two will be released.
The patterns will be delivered automatically to your Ravelry inbox or by email if you purchase on Gumroad, so opening your message is like peeking behind the window of an advent calendar to see whats inside!
Go ahead and create your first project page ready for when the pattern comes out: there will be a special giveaway prize announced soon!
Level of pattern difficulty - adventurous beginner to intermediate.

Release dates for Knitvent 2022: 

Thursday, October 27th: Secret Pattern #1
Thursday, November 3rd: Secret Pattern #2
Thursday, November 10th Secret Patterns #3 & 4
Thursday, November 17th: Secret Pattern #5
Thursday, November 24th: Secret Pattern #6

|#knitvent2022

pattern_sources.name: Curious Countdown Advent Knits
pattern_sources.notes:
Easy knitting patterns for mini skeins, yarn scraps and yarn holiday calendars

Knit your way through the holiday season with this collection of scrappy countdown patterns. These cosy, colourful cowls, wraps and throws are all designed to be made out of 24 mini skeins, whether pulled from your stash or a curated advent calendar set from an indie dyer. 

Every year since 2017, the advent pattern has been the star of each Curious Handmade Knitvent collection. Now Ive gathered six of them into one book, along with a simple bonus cowl that will help you use up the scrappiest scraps in your stash. 

All seven projects in the Curious Countdown Collection are pure comfort knitting: achievable even for beginners and new knitters, with simple but engaging stitch patterns. 

Knitting with mini skeins and yarn scraps is so much fun. When you add in the excitement of the festive season and the soothing rhythm of knitting a little every day, you have a recipe for knitting bliss.

The Curious Countdown Collection includes:

Land of Sweets Cowl
Dust of Snow Wrap
Habitation Throw
Hearten Cowl
Skyline Wrap
Anthology Throw
Simply Scrappy Cowl

pattern_sources.author: Maja Klvdal
pattern_sources.name: Other Loops_
pattern_sources.notes:
Other Loops / otherloops.com

> If you have questions, comments or
> need knitting support, you are welcome
> to write to us on
> support@otherloops.com

 

Behind Other Loops you will meet up with Maja Klvdal, who has a degree as fashion designer from the Design School Kolding in Denmark DK:DK Since her education, Maja has made a career in the fashion industry, where she has worked and accelerated the growth for several well-known Danish fashion brands.

Other Loops are born from Majas dream of making more slow fashion and returning to her own roots, which is to create and develop on the actual craft.
Maja focus on aesthetics, quality and details that go side by side with the traditions of Scandinavian design.

Maja create classic and modern knitwear patterns that suite your needs of long-lasting design. Other Loops put heart into developing precise patterns that are straight forward for you to understand, so your personal knitting skills elevate up to next level.

Otherloops.com develop aesthetic quality design for you and the future to come.

For more inspiration you can also follow the brand on Instagram @otherloops
If you have questions, comments or need knitting support, you are welcome to write to us on support@otherloops.com 
Pattern is solely for private use and must not be copied, resold, or shared. Products made from the patterns may not be sold.

pattern_sources.notes:
> **[Brioche Del Mar][1]**

Brioche Del Mar is an ode to the many shorelines Ive strolled over the years and the wonderful Caf del Mar chill-out albums I listened to endlessly in the late 90s.

Brioche Del Mar is the perfect combination of knitting to keep you engaged at the start, watch T.V. knitting the body, and then re-engage you for a two colour Brioche finish (the hem)! 

This oversized top, lots of positive airy ease, is worked seamlessly from the top down. It starts out with a separate back worked in the flat, and then the front to the arm holes. The fronts and backs are joined to work down in the round to the Brioche hem after the armholes are complete. Two colour brioche ends the sweater with a scalloped shell edge.

The sleeves have two cuff options  either a mesh eyelet or a simple twisted rib  you decide!



  [1]: https://www.ravelry.com/patterns/library/brioche-del-mar

pattern_sources.notes:
**Please note: This Pattern Collection does not participate in any promotion or coupon discount!**

The knitter's guide to the galaxy! Four patterns with an innovative shaping for triangular shawlettes: Hitchhiker, Trillian, Magrathea and Lintilla. Their names come from Douglas Adams' great series of books "The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy", because the prototype of the first pattern happened to have exactly 42 teeth - and 42 is kind of a magic number in these books. The shawlettes are all based on garter stitch and work especially well with handdyed, variegated fingering-weight yarn.
Download includes German, English and Russian versions. Discount compared to purchase of single patterns: 2.60 Euros.

pattern_sources.author: Kate Davies
pattern_sources.name: Margery Allingham's Mysterious Knits
pattern_sources.notes:
*What happens when you bring literary plot and pattern design together?* 

Margery Allingham was one of the undoubted queens of British detective fictions Golden Age, and this bringing together of novel-inspired handknits with critical, contextual essays offers an in-the-round celebration of her work. Kate Davies collection speaks to the detective authors inventive spirit: a single, unbroken strand of yarn transforms itself into a three-dimensional slipper; hats and pullovers are knitted from side to side, while a triangular shawl up-ends itself to eventually become a cardigan. The techniques are all contemporary, but theres a nod to classic twentieth-century knitting style as well: narrow garter-stitch stripes meet modern short row shaping, while slipped stitches and Art Deco chevrons are incoporated into light knits that will work in many wardrobes. Alongside this most mysterious collection, literary contributors explore themes that illuminate Margery Allinghams creative world: from the relationship between patterns and plotting, to the fashion, film and popular culture of the 1930s and 1940s; from the wide ranging role played by knitting and knitters in detective fiction, to the distinctive Essex landscape that inspired Margery Allingham throughout her life. Chock full of revelations, plot twists, and (of course) the occasional red herring, this highly original exploration of one of detective fictions most ingenious authors is sure to surprise and delight. 

Contributors: Tom Barr, Caroline Crampton, Kate Davies, Veronica Horwell, Julia Jones, Sarah Mackay, Imogen Robertson.

pattern_sources.notes:
The Bay Area Yarn Cowl Collection was thoughtfully designed to offer:

**Skill Building for the Adventurous Beginner!**
All three patterns are great for learning a new craft. Maybe you're a knitter who never learned to crochet (or vice versa) or maybe you're curious about hybrid (Tunisian) crochet; these patterns are for you! 

All three patterns include helpful videos and clear, tech-edited instructions, to insure your success.

**Potato Chip Crafting!**
Each of the patterns has that "one more row" quality, making them all quick to finish.

**Social Crafting!**
Your BAYCrawl Carpool can get together and make matching BAYCrawl Cowls. With six weeks between now and the Crawl, you've got enough time to make a cowl...or two...or maybe even all three!

**A Great Opportunity to Use That One Special Skein in Your Stash!**
Two-color stripes are ideal for playing with color, allowing you to stash dive or treat yourself to a kit. All three patterns are written for two colors of smooth DK weight yarn.

pattern_sources.author: Summer Lee
pattern_sources.name: The Sock Project: Colorful, Cool Socks to Knit and Show Off
pattern_sources.notes:
Oklahoma native and proud member of the Muscogee-Creek Nation, Summer Lee shares her knitting secrets for creating all shapes and sizes of socks with dots, zigzags, stripes, and a near-neon palette of happy colors.

Sock projects are universally loved by knitters, but popular knitting creator Summer Lee has turned this favorite pastime topsy turvy with designs that feature the most electric colors and wow-patterns ever dreamt up. The Sock Project is a book for every crafter: beginners who want to learn, knitters who want to improve their sock skills, and anyone who wants to fill their knitting needlesand sock drawerswith jazzy colors and new designs.

Build your skills month-by-month with 12 levels of sock knitting. First, start with the humble-but-mighty Basic Sock, then try more complicated patterns for lace socks, cabled socks, socks with Estonian Inlay, and socks done in stranded knitting. Youll be able to sample 18 fresh and zippy patterns, plus new variations on favorite designs! The Sock Project is a joyful Starburst-color explosion for adventurous knitters everywhere.

The sock designs in Westknits Year of Socks 2025 are available with the e-book. You will receive a new sock pattern each month in 2025. The sock patterns will be available to purchase individually in 2026.

pattern_sources.notes: Hi, I'm Jessica! Mama, Colorado gal, lover of yarn and life. I like sharing my easy & timeless knit and crochet projects and patterns.  Over the last several years, my blog has become not only a place where I share my projects but also my designing outlet! I'm thrilled to have kits made by Lion Brand Yarn and to have been able to join such a wonderful community of knitters and crocheters.  Thank you for your inspiration.  I hope you can find some of your own inspiration on my blog and enjoy my designs! You might also find some DIY's, random thoughts and a bit of nature - Come on in!
